instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..
definitions.820-00923: What is 820-00923? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A, that after replacing de display, it stooped working. Already replaced with a known good lcd, and ot doesn't power on.

I has 19.5V on ampmeter, and consumes around 0.55 A to 0.86 A (only board. Full assembled and with battery it gets to around 2A).  CPU gets hot, but it seams to don't have CPU activity, because the caps lock doesn't turn on, and doesn't show any image on external monitor.
Can't see any damage components on board.

<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> = 1V
<SIGNAL>PPVCC_CPU</SIGNAL> PH1/2 = 1V
<SIGNAL>PPDCPRTC_PCH</SIGNAL>= 1.6V
PPVCCGT = 0V

What should i check?

Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message:
Check for knocked off components.
Was the battery disconnected???

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message:
Hi,
Yes the battery was disconected, and there are no  knocked off components.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message:
The board cannot die by itself.
There was wrong manipulation.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message: That is my problem. I can't see anything wrong... maybe it was static electricity or something like that. Do you have any idea of what / where should I start taking measures? I already spend hours looking and I really can't see any knocked off components...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message:
You should note some changes on the <SIGNAL>VCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>.
If starts and stays at 1V, board doesn't really boot.
You can compare its behavior with known good working board.

<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> comes high?
Test the board alone on the desk; no device connected.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message:
Hi, thank you.

Full assembled it responds to the SMC Reset on the keyboard and the fans start spining, but it doesn't do anything else.

With board alone i get:
<SIGNAL>VCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> oscillates between 1.08V and 1.09V and doesn't drop to 0V.
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>  = 3.3V

Already tried SMC bypass without success.

Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message: Can anyone help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message:
Damage induced when the LCD assembly was changed.
Should be mechanical problem, like broken trace, or knocked off components.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message:
Thank you!.
I already spend hours looking on the microscope, and I can't see anything wrong. Can I measure something to figure out the area that i should look deeper? 
Is there any way to narow down the area? 
I really can't see nothing wrong on the board and don't know what else to do...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message: Try known good BIOS, just in case...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message: tks. Couldn't find no Clean ME on the forum. Do you have it please?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message:
Try this one.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message:
Thanks.
After install the Clean ME, it has the same behavier (doesn't boot), but now one of the fans boots at full rpm and the other fan is stoped.  <SIGNAL>VCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>  is at 1.08V steady...
What else should i do?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message:
Test again with original BIOS.
See if changes behavior.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message:
Hi,
After installing the original BIOS, the laptop has similar, btut different,  behavier (no fan spin and 1.08V on  <SIGNAL>VCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> )

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message:
Im having the exact same issue right now. (Ship in repair)

My client stated that he did a screen replacement. After screen replacement, he stated touchbar did not work. So when he was disconnecting flexes, he heard a chime, at which point he realized that the battery was still connected. Very similar behavior. I get fan spin when CPU gets hot enough, board seems to be booting, but no internal or external image. I am getting 1v06 on <SIGNAL>VCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>, and then it drops to about .640v after about 10 seconds or so.  <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is a steady 3v3

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message: You should have USB activity in this case.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message:
Hi,
Who should have USB  activity ? Me or Dusten04?
I don't have any USB  activity .
After installing the original BIOS, the laptop has similar, but different,  behavier (no fan spin and 1.08V steady on  <SIGNAL>VCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>). Do you have any other idea about what can be wrong in my case?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no boot
threads.message:
No activity possible, if CPU core voltage stays fixed at 1.08V.

Dusten04, please open other thread, to avoid confusions.
